comment: My online class was a breeze. Don't even waste time on taking notes, tests are not lockdown so use other resources. Just put in the effort and it will be easy. There are two plays you have to watch in person and write about, but they're actually interesting. She is clear on what she is asking for grade. Ask questions through email. Just put effort.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Her most interesting module was by a guest lecturer. Was a fine course, but very long lectures, very picky-worded test questions. If she mentions a small random detail in the lecture, it will be on the test. Few discussions, replies to others are mandatory. Textbook wasn't used much. Doable to complete the week's reading & assignment's in an hour.

Very easy class. Everything was posted on sunday and was then due the following Sunday. Had to see 2 in person performances and write a short answer to questions she gives you. Uses lockdown browser but says you can use textbook on exams and quizzes. If you can, TAKE HER

I took it online, and it was easy: weekly quizzes (2 attempts, guaranteed 100), 1 midterm, 1 final, 4 mini assignments (2 long discussion posts, 2 essays on required in-person events). Uses lockdown browser (no webcam). No need to buy the textbook or play; her lessons covered virtually everything, and she shared a free video of the play.

Professor Leeman's course is pretty average and easy. There are 1 hr lectures and one quiz each week. Don't do the chapter readings, she covers all of that in her lectures. There are three "mini" assignments, however they take awhile, so give yourself time to do them. You do have to attend a KSU play and write an essay on it. Overall, not too bad.

I took this as an online, 4 week, summer course. Dr. Leeman is the ideal online professor! Her lectures are engaging, interesting, & add to the class. Very fast paced- I spent 3+ hours a day on reading/homework/quizzes. But, this class is fun! You spend a lot of time watching videos- improv, a play, lots of YouTube videos. An A is very doable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Online Savvy

comment: The class was extremely easy but you have to watch a play and write an essay which sucks. If you are taking this just for an easy A I recommend.

The layout of the course was amazing. Professor Leeman provided very informative, but still short lectures weekly. Weekly quizzes were not difficult if you paid half attention to the lectures. I think she recognizes that this course fills a gen-ed requirement and is not overbearing or over demanding.

She is great! It was an online class, so super easy. There was a required event, to purchase a ticket and watch "Jitney" in person at a KSU theatre. It was a good play, glad I was forced to go. To be honest, you do not need to even watch her lectures. There is a few plays that she will test you over, but it was hardly any reading.

This class is not hard at all. As long as you watch the lectures which are usually 30 minutes max, you'll be fine on the quizzes. There are 3 mini assignments within the semester which aren't too bad. Then, there are 2 big papers you have to write based on the required events you have to attend, but she's not a tough grader at all.

She doesn't make this class hard. We have short lectures and short quizzes due. Multiple attempts on quizzes. Notes can be used on the exam. Few assignments. 2 required events(virtual & in person) with a short paper attached. You would have to try to fail this class or do nothing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Online Savvy

comment: No.. Just No. I am taking her this semester online. Her class is pretty easy but her assignments are insane. "Mini" Assignments aren't mini at all. There is a lot of work for so little points. Mini assignments include 2-3 part segments for 25 points. When she says an assignment is "fun" or "mini" buckle up buttercup.. Its gonna be a lot.

She is a great professor but she does want you to learn about theater. Overall super easy class and she makes sure that you understand what you are learning. She is an amazing professor I highly recommend.
This class was a last-minute choice and although I am not a fan of the arts Professor Leeman makes you appreciate them. The classwork is overall easy and actually really fun!

She is very nice and you can tell that she cares but the layout of her inline class is so confusing that it was very hard for me to locate assignments and deadlines. Because of this I missed an assignment or two and the assignments that I did do and were clear to way too much time and effort for what its worth. Great person and very sweet though

Professor Leeman can be lenient and does want you to do well in her class. She does really love and care about theatre as well. BUT if you have the option, take a different professor. She gives an insane amount of work! I have spent more time on this class than any other this semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Took the online version of her class. Seems like she cares a lot about theatre but the amount of work just for a beginner theatre class is a little ridiculous. You have to read a textbook and go through the lectures and then post dbas and do quizzes often. She wants lots of essays by the end of the semester (final project, final and an essay )
Good class. Can be challenging if you don't put in the effort. Professor really cares.
